text: head down,look down,lower head,lower your head
who=Chris,when=.5,do=say:Welcome teacher, we're glad that you're here today.+act:interrupt
who=Luis,when=6,do=say:In the next 3 minutes, we are going to give you a tour of our classroom and invite you to learn from us what we like to read.+act:interrupt

who=Farrah,when=15,do=say:Before we get started let's take a couple deep breaths together. Breathe in through your nose, hold your breath, now breathe out. Go ahead and take another breath. Breathing helps us relax and learn from our practice.+act:interrupt
who=Luis,when=27,do=say:Okay, now, drag your mouse to walk around our classroom.+act:interrupt

who=Jazmin,when=42,do=say:Teacher, Do you like to read fiction or nonfiction? Click on the pencil icon on the toolbar to write on our blackboard. Circle the one you you most like to read.+act:interrupt+slide:0Draw

who=Jazmin,when=67,do=say:Call on us by name and ask us the question on the board Tell us about what you like to read. Press your spacebar to talk to us.+act:interrupt+slide:0Question1+slide:1Question2+close:blackboard
who=Chris,when=137,do=say:It's time for us to go to our next class, but before we go, click on the graph in the toolbar to see what we did today+act:interrupt
who=Farrah,when=147,do=say:On the left you will see ways that students responses differed to help you adjust your teaching to meet our needs.+act:interrupt
who=Sharleen,when=157,do=say:The graph shows student responses along the bottom and your responses above each student by type of feedback we think you provided.+act:interrupt
who=Chris,when=163,do=say:At the end of this session you can press the play button to replay the types of feedback you gave given to students.+act:interrupt
who=Luis,when=182,do=say:Now, you can use what you learned about our reading habits to plan future lessons for us.+close:graph
who=Chris,when=189,do=say:Click on the notebook in the toolbar to download more teaching resources
who=Farrah,when=202,do=say:You can continue to talk with us, if you'd like
